data: PLACE HOLDER FOR CPD NAME AND URL: Refer to Clinical Practice Document: Radiographs (X-Ray) Nurse Requistioning of Distal Upper and Distal Lower Extremity (Adult 17 years and older)
Use a standardized pain scale, such as verbal rating scale (0 to 10) or faces pain scale
Acute Mild or Moderate Pain (pain scale 0-7 out of 10)
If pain is mild to moderate, refer to NIA Acute Mild to Moderate Pain (Adult)
Once, then q4h for 24 hour: Frequency?
Immediate referral to the EP / NP for assessment if patient shows any signs of nerovascular compromise, diminished pulses, or obvious dislocation / sever deformity
Notify treating provider ED NIP Radiographs (X-Ray) Nurse Requistioning of Distal Upper and Lower Extremity (Adult) has been initiated and radiographs were requested and completed and need review
